description: Temporary (12 months) retention of the existing brick structure to house the temporary electricity supply for the development, located within the entrance to the site from St John Street at ground floor level
decision_conditions:
CONDITION: The limited period for the retention of the temporary building shall be for no longer than 11 months from the date of this perimission or if secured prior to this time for an additional 2 weeks after permanent power supply has been secured to the development. On or before expiry of the limited period the building shall be removed and the ground reinstated and made good in accordance with details as approved under the planning application P051176 as amended in accordance with s73 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (LBI ref: P091840 dated 10 April 2010 or any subsequent planning approval under Section 73).

 REASON: The type of building is not such as the Authority is prepared to approve, other than for a limited period, having regard to its appearance and effect on visual amenity, in accordance with policies D1, D3, D4, D5, Env12 and Env17 of the Islington UDP 2002 and policies 4B.1, 4B.2 and 4B.6 of the London Plan 2008.
